sentences.english: There were about four to five hundred people watching outside the court till the trail ended.
sentences.chinese: 至庭审结束，大约有四五百人在法院外围观。

sentences.english: The case is now before the court.
sentences.chinese: 这个案子现在已交庭审理。

sentences.english: In some places, jurors may ask questions during the trial.
sentences.chinese: 在有些地方，陪审员在庭审中可以提出问题。

sentences.english: Trials concern events that affect the community in which they occur.
sentences.chinese: 庭审涉及的案件对其发生地的社区产生影响。

sentences.english: Strengthening the function of court trial requires more of Cross - examination and Attestation.
sentences.chinese: 强化庭审功能必然也对质证和认证提出了新的要求。

sentences.english: Last, the court procedure is interesting.
The appeals court has agreed to hear that case next week.
sentences.chinese: 上诉庭同意下周开庭审理那件案子。

sentences.english: The court case is scheduled for 29 January in Madras.
sentences.chinese: 这起案件将于1月29日在印度马德拉斯开庭审理。

sentences.english: During the court trial, the defendant told the breeding Xu This is the reason.
sentences.chinese: 在庭审中，被告人徐某道出了滋生这种想法的缘由。

sentences.english: Dressed in black for the trial, eyes hidden behind sunglasses, Linor had to be strong.
sentences.chinese: 庭审时林诺身着黑衣头戴墨镜，表现得很坚强。

sentences.english: Then the prosecutor begins the most critical part of the trial.
sentences.chinese: 公诉人然后开始庭审的最关键部分，即传唤证人。

sentences.english: Onlya victim or his family can initiate a court action.
sentences.chinese: 只有被害人或他的家族可以启动一个庭审程序。

sentences.english: The relationship that often develops between a jury and its presiding judge is one of trust.
sentences.chinese: 在陪审团与主持庭审的法官之间经常建立起互信关系。

sentences.english: He is scheduled to appear in court next Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 预期他将在下周二的庭审中露面。

sentences.english: It is not the custom at German trials for defendants to question the judge.
sentences.chinese: 在德国进行法庭庭审时，没有被告人质问法官的习惯。

sentences.english: Impeachment Trials The Senate shall have the sole power to try all impeachments .
sentences.chinese: 在开庭审理弹劾案时，参议员们均应宣誓或誓愿。

definition: examination of the evidence of the opposing party in a court of law
to pronounce a sentence (after a verdict in a court of law)
public opinion/public announcement of verdict at a trial
to retire from the courtroom/to adjourn
